nodes.bodyText: The first date should not be changed (it should remain 2013); the second date should be 2020 (or soon 2021).
While you're changing this comment can you also fix the grammar, please (e.g. 'an argument')?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -81,30 +81,36 @@ private String token() throws Exception {
          * otherwise it will ends up returning an empty argument to be ignored in forming the command array.
          *
          * Three cases are taken into account in the while loop:
-         * 1) Strings in double-quotes (a argument starting with double-quotes(")) are completely extracted from the command string,
-         *    whether white spaces in the argument exist or not. Double-quotes themselves are discarded after extraction when scanning forward.
-         * 2) Normal arguments (no double-quotes occur in the argument) are split up and extracted with white spaces between arguments.
+         * 1) Strings in double-quotes/single-quotes (a argument starting with double-quotes(") or single-quotes(')) are completely extracted from the command string,

@@ -81,30 +81,36 @@ private String token() throws Exception {
          * otherwise it will ends up returning an empty argument to be ignored in forming the command array.
          *
          * Three cases are taken into account in the while loop:
-         * 1) Strings in double-quotes (a argument starting with double-quotes(")) are completely extracted from the command string,
-         *    whether white spaces in the argument exist or not. Double-quotes themselves are discarded after extraction when scanning forward.
-         * 2) Normal arguments (no double-quotes occur in the argument) are split up and extracted with white spaces between arguments.
+         * 1) Strings in double-quotes/single-quotes (a argument starting with double-quotes(") or single-quotes(')) are completely extracted from the command string,

nodes.bodyText: Also fixed!  I should have done it that way to begin with.  Thanks for pointing this out!
This will now need to be updated for 2021.
Please fix the grammar here (we're searching for a singular quote).
do you mean like this: "... another double-quotes/single-quote since they..."?
If I were writing that comment, I would say 'search for the closing quote' (I don't think we need to repeatedly say 'double-quote/single-quote').
Please fix indentation to match surrounding code.
